cultural adjective
(WAY OF LIFE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B1 relating to the habits, traditions, and beliefs of a society: The US is often accused of cultural imperialism. Australia has its own cultural identity, which is very different from that of Britain. cultural diversity/differences cultural heritage (= ways of living and thinking that have existed for a long time in a society)
More examplesFewer examplesIt is a study of the social and cultural milieu in which Michelangelo lived and worked.The country is now a cultural and social mosaic due to the influx of several different ethnic groups.The best films are those which transcend national or cultural barriers.The era was characterized by political and cultural turbulence.
